Description: A description that describes the element's purpose.
Adds a listener for changes in the user's preferred captioning enabled state and visual properties.
Return the user's preferred font scaling factor for video captions, or 1 if not specified
Return the locale for the user's preferred captioning language, or null if not specified
Return the user's preferred visual properties for captions as a CaptionStyle, or the default style if not specified This value cannot be null.
Return the user's preferred captioning enabled state.
Removes a listener previously added using addCaptioningChangeListener(CaptioningManager.CaptioningChangeListener).
The orientation of the activity's display on the device.
The type of data being placed in a text field, used to help an input method decide how to let the user enter text.
If set, specifies that this TextView should use the specified input method (specified by fully-qualified class name).
If set, specifies that this TextView has a phone number input method. The default is false.
Whether the characters of the field are displayed as password dots instead of themselves.
If set, specifies that this TextView has a numeric input method. The default is false.

If set, specifies that this TextView has a numeric input method and that these specific characters are the ones that it will accept. If this is set, numeric is implied to be true. The default is false.
If set, specifies that this TextView has a textual input method and automatically corrects some common spelling errors. The default is "false".
If set, specifies that this TextView has an input method. It will be a textual one unless it has otherwise been specified. For TextView, this is false by default. For EditText, it is true by default.
Sets the background color for this view.
Sets the text color.
This setting makes it easier to optimize the text size on different screens with dynamic content. Works only for TextView.
You can achieve automatic font scaling in your app using scale-independent pixels
Sets the horizontal scaling factor for the text.
The maximum text size constraint to be used when auto-sizing text.
The minimum text size constraint to be used when auto-sizing text.
Specify whether this widget should automatically scale the text to try to perfectly fit within the layout bounds.
Extra spacing between lines of text, as a multiplier. The value will not be applied for the last line of text.
Extra spacing between lines of text. The value will not be applied for the last line of text.
Sets text letter-spacing in em units. Typical values for slight expansion will be around 0.05. Negative values tighten text.
In your activity's layout XML file, set the android:animateLayoutChanges attribute to true for the layout that you want to enable animations for.
Defines the next view to give focus to when the next focus is View.FOCUS_FORWARD
Defines the next view to give focus to when the next focus is View.FOCUS_UP
Defines the next view to give focus to when the next focus is View.FOCUS_DOWN
Defines the next view to give focus to when the next focus is View.FOCUS_LEFT
Defines the next view to give focus to when the next focus is View.FOCUS_RIGHT
The title this view should present to accessibility as a pane title.
The element on which you are setting this property is the element “before” and “after” are referring to.
The element on which you are setting this property is the element “before” and “after” are referring to.
Allows TalkBack users to skim headings skipping content.
Makes the cursor visible (the default) or invisible.
Defines the minimum width of the view.
Defines the minimum height of the view.
Whether this view should be treated as a focusable unit by screen reader accessibility tools.
Controls whether a view can take focus.
Hint text to display when the text is empty.
Sets the id of a view for which this view serves as a label for accessibility purposes.
It is an opportunity for us to give our customer more information about what our control is capable of and how.
Replaces an action. This can be used to change the default behavior or label of the action specified. If label and command are both null, the action will be removed.
Indicates to accessibility services whether the user should be notified when this view changes.
Describes whether or not this view is important for accessibility. If it is important, the view fires accessibility events and is reported to accessibility services that query the screen.
Boolean that controls whether a view should have haptic feedback enabled for events such as long presses.
Sends an accessibility event of the given type. If accessibility is not enabled this method has no effect.
This method is used when the calling code needs to directly control the check for accessibility being enabled on the device.
The system calls this method when your custom view generates an accessibility event.
This method sets the spoken text prompt of the AccessibilityEvent for your view.
The system calls this method when a child of your view has generated an AccessibilityEvent.
Called by RecyclerView to display the data at the specified position. This method should update the contents of the itemView to reflect the item at the given position.
